name: Smoked Sunflower Seeds
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: The next time you fire up the smoker, plan to save room for this treat that you can enjoy long after the ribs are gone. Three ingredients and a little bit of patience is all you need. Store in an airtight container.
directions: Bring water and salt to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat
Turn heat off and stir in sunflower seeds
Preheat the smoker to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
Add wood chips according to manufacturer's directions
Drain water from sunflower seeds but do not rinse
Place seeds inside a disposable foil pan
Smoke for 3 hours, shaking the pan every hour
Remove pan from the smoker and let seeds cool
